data.title: Mount Gretna Bible Festival
data.meta_description: Events at Mount Gretna Bible Festival
data.text:
Sunday, June 9, 2024 - Principally Harps - 7 p.m. Blending the talents and expertise of two of America's finest harpists, Mindy Cutcher and Janet Witman, who have over 30 years of professional harp experience as teachers, soloists, ensemble and orchestral performs in the Mid Atlantic region. Their duo playing has been described as, "artistry in tandem". Freewill Offering will be received.

Sunday, June 16, 2024 - Andy Roberts w/Four Piece Quartet & Guests - 7 p.m. Mt. Gretna's own Andy Roberts will praise God with original jazz song stylings. Freewill Offering will be received. Sponsored by JoAnn Thomas Show.

Sunday, June 23, 2024 - New Holland Band - 7 p.m. Formed in 1829 and the second oldest municipal band in the nation, the New Holland Band will play patriotic and spiritual music. Fred Hughes Jr. - Music Director. Freewill Offering will be received. Sponsored by Cornwall Manor.

Sunday, June 30, 2024 - Wheatland Chorale - 7 p.m. Under the direction of David J. Fitzpatrick, new Artistic Director, Wheatland Chorale is excited to perform for the first time at the Bible Festival. This concert by one of the area's premier choral ensembles will be sure to leave you feeling inspired. Freewill Offering will be received. Sponsored by Bob & Lib Kettering in celebration of their 50th wedding anniversary.

*****Sunday, July 7, 2024 - Phredd Ukulele One Man Band (Fred McNaughton) - SPECIAL PROGRAM FOR CHILDREN - 3 p.m. Ukulele Flailing, Harmonica Wailing, Suitcase Drumming, Kazoo Hum-Humming, Ukulele Bundle of Joy! Freewill Offering will be received.******

COME EARLY for a "Community Arts Party" and help paint the entrance for this year's Mt. Gretna Art Show and play instruments provided by Gretna Music. Sponsored by Mt. Gretna Outdoor Art Show.

Sunday, July 7, 2024- Amy Yovanovich and Brenten Megee - 7 p.m. A program of spirituals and music by American composers plus an audience sing-along. Accompanied by Dr. Ross Ellison and Sue Fry-Wickard. Freewill Offering will be received.

Sunday, July 14, 2024 - Dr. Chris Walker is the Sr. Pastor at Westminster Presbyterian Church, Lancaster, Pa., and the preacher on the weekly radio broadcast 'The Westminster Pulpit' on WDAC radio. His degrees are from Hillsdale College and Westminster Theological Seminary. Musicians from Westminster Church will provide special music for the service - 7 p.m. Freewill Offering will be received.

Sunday, July 21, 2024 - Knotwork Band - 7 p.m. The Knotwork Band is a trio that performs Celtic folk music from Ireland, Scotland, England, and Brittany, as well as American and World music with ties to Celtic folk music, either musically or historically. Freewill Offering will be received.

Sunday, July 28, 2024 - Choir Festival - 7 p.m. Composer Craig Courtney will direct 100 voices in a joyous Sunday Concert. Accompanist Dan Dorty will be joined by flute and brass. Freewill Offering will be received. Sponsored by Loser's Music. Concert made possible by the Estate of Douglas Troutman. Singers can register online this year by clicking on this link: Zeffy To request a printable file contact: office@mtgretnatabernacle.org Click Here to download a poster for the event.

Wednesday, July 31, 2024 - Hymn Sing - 7 p.m. Congregational favorites from the Celebration Hymnal led by Bob Kettering and Dr. Rod Shearer. Freewill Offering will be received.
